pesticide.PPE: long sleeve shirt, long pants, shoes, socks and waterproof gloves, and dust/mist filtering respirator (MSHA/NIOSH approval number prefix TC-21C) or a NIOSH-approved respirator with any R, P or HE filter

Safety_Information.general_Info: Causes moderate eye irritation. Harmful if inhaled or absorbed through the skin. Avoid contact with eyes, skin, ingestion or inhalation. Avoid breathing dust (vapor or spray mist). Wash thoroughly with soap and water after handling. Remove contaminated clothing and wash before reuse.
Safety_Information.if_In_Eyes: Hold eyes open and rinse slowly with water for 15-20 minutes. Remove contact lenses, if present after the first 5 minutes then continue rinsing eye. Call a poison center or a doctor for further treatment or advise.
Safety_Information.if_Swallowed: Call a poison center or a doctor for further treatment or advise. Have person sip water if able to swallow. Do not induce vomiting unless told to do so by the poison control center or doctor. Do not give anything by mouth to an unconscious person.
Safety_Information.if_Inhaled: Move person to fresh air. If person is not breathing call 911 or an ambulance, then give artificial respiration, preferably by mouth to mouth, if possible. Call a poison center or a doctor for further treatment or advise.
Safety_Information.if_On_Skin: Take off contaminated clothing. Rinse skin immediately with plenty of water for 15-20 minutes. Call a poison center or a doctor for further treatment or advise.
Safety_Information.physician_Note: May cause moderate eye irritation which will last a short time. This product does NOT contain any petroleum, caustics or active solvent products. Have the product container or label with you when you call a poison control center or doctor or going for treatment. You may call 800-325-3055 or 314-770-0717 7:30AM-5PM CST Mon-Fri or the National Pesticide Information Center (NPIC) at 1-800-858-7378.
